definition: to rock/to sway/to flicker (e.g. of lights reflected on water)/to flutter (e.g. of a flag)/to trick sb into doing sth/to dupe/to con
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried
indifferent to the passing of time/careless

sentences.english: At most you are only a foolish elephant fooled by some people, HAWHAW.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，你頂多是一頭被別人忽悠的笨象。

sentences.english: Don't let the "honeys" and "babies" fool you.
sentences.chinese: 不要讓“親愛的和寶貝”忽悠你。

sentences.english: Ignore the stock market rally, the world is heading for a long stretch of stagflation
sentences.chinese: 莫被股市反彈忽悠，世界已坐上了通往滯漲的地鐵。

sentences.english: It's hard to make a case that China is importing U.
sentences.chinese: 說中國人搶了美國人的工作就是個大忽悠。

sentences.english: No one ever says it's the tricked-up microwave they got at Wal-Mart.
sentences.chinese: 沒人說他們要帶着自己在沃爾瑪被忽悠買來的微波爐。

sentences.english: In addition to dry a day coolies, but also bear a number of leader's Cheat.
sentences.chinese: 每天除了幹苦力，還要承受許多領導的忽悠。

sentences.english: This guy fobbed off a fake diamond on me.
sentences.chinese: 這個人拿一個假鑽石忽悠了我。

sentences.english: Rising, we are f uc king your digital world.
sentences.chinese: 瑞星，我們忽悠您的數字世界。

sentences.english: Various deceptive means are hardly preventable.
sentences.chinese: 各種各樣的忽悠手段是防不勝防的。

sentences.english: He says is there anything I can’t pids?
sentences.chinese: 他問我有沒有什麼題材是我不能忽悠的？

sentences.english: The investor was bamboozled to buy junk bond.
sentences.chinese: 這個股民被忽悠，買了垃圾股。

sentences.english: We needed her help but were fobbed off by promises.
sentences.chinese: 我們很需要她的幫助，但她用空頭支票忽悠了我們。

sentences.english: Don't be fooled by the gangster facade.
sentences.chinese: 不要被該遊戲中那些匪徒式的外表給忽悠了。

sentences.english: He bluffed me into believing that his coat was made of tiger skin.
sentences.chinese: 他忽悠得我相信他的大衣是虎皮做的。

sentences.english: Big network, flickers similarly the matter, is occurring every day.
sentences.chinese: 網絡之大，類似忽悠的事情，每天都在發生。

sentences.english: In many cases, they are trying to put a good spin on bad results.
sentences.chinese: 在許多情況下，他們試圖把壞的結果忽悠成形勢大好。

definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
taken in (by sb's deceit)/to be fooled/to be duped
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
graceful words, flowery speech (idiom); elegant but insincere words/cheating wheedling/dishonest rhetoric
